thread.title: Top seeds East Coweta, Madras to meet Tuesday for CCMSAL title
thread.title_full: Top seeds East Coweta, Madras to meet Tuesday for CCMSAL title

title: Top seeds East Coweta, Madras to meet Tuesday for CCMSAL title
text:
Top seeds East Coweta, Madras to meet Tuesday for CCMSAL title Sunday, October 18, 2015 Comments 
Postseason seeding held firm in this year’s Coweta County Middle School Athletic League football playoffs, with top-ranked East Coweta set to meet No. 2 Madras in Tuesday’s championship game, which is set for a 6 p.m. kickoff at Garland Shoemake Stadium. 
The Indians stayed perfect on the season in last week’s semifinals, advancing with a 26-6 victory at home over Evans while scoring in all three phases. 
Madras, meanwhile, set up a rematch from a regular- season loss to East Coweta by advancing past underdog Lee, winning 19-8. 
East Coweta held Evans to a 2-yard touchdown in the first quarter before using two scores in the second period to build some breathing room. 
The Indians opened the scoring when Cade Tredwell returned a fumble 33 yards for the first points of the game and Dylan Lewis’ extra point pushed East Coweta in front 7-0. 
Despite Evans responding immediately, the Cougars’ opening score was followed by a blocked extra point that allowed ECMS to hang on to a one-point lead. 
The Indians then ramped up its offense in the second quarter with a pair of 27-yard touchdowns. Javontae Rosser made it 20-6 on a run. Shortly afterward, Corey Bridges connected with Chris Moore from the same distance. Lewis’ extra-point pushed East Coweta further ahead 20-6 at halftime. 
Defenses took over in the second half, with neither offense scoring after halftime. 
The lone touchdown following the break came on Austin Bunn’s fumble recovery of a fumbled punt. 
Madras and East Coweta met during the regular season on Sept. 15, in a game won by East Coweta 48-18. 
Madras, which last won the CCMSAL Championship in 2013, picked up two touchdowns from Jake Barberio in the second quarter on runs of 2 and 52 yards in last week’s semifinal win over Lee. 
Tanner Hughes added an 81-yard scamper after halftime for the Eagles. The defensive effort for the Eagles was led by Barron Sher- rer, Donovan Brundidge and Camden Brooks. 
EAST COWETA FEEDER TEAMS GO UNDEFEATED: A majority of players from last year’s CCMSAL champion- ship team from Lee continued to make an impact while moving closer to joining the varsity. 
East Coweta’s ninth grade team recently finished its 2015 season unbeaten for the first time after defeating Northgate 20-7 on Wednesday. The Indians’ wins also came against Whitewater (27- 6), Sandy Creek (34-14) and Newnan (22-12). 
The team also overcame adversity during the season following the death of lineman Desmond Byrd. East Coweta honored his mem- ory prior to its victory over Newnan. 
“They dedicated this season to him,” said East Coweta coach Todd Beldon. 
East Coweta’s junior varsity also finished undefeated this year. More
